CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper December 8, 1956, pg. A17, reads: "Gridder Beats Paralysis - With dauntless courage inspired by St. Francis Hospital nurses like Sister M. Clarita, 17-year-old Robert Brown of Fairmont, W. Va., returned home this week fully recovered from paralysis which kept him helpless since Aug. 20. Brown's illness resulted in football practice when the football struck him in the stomach causing the psychological block which paralyzed him. His recovery was speeded by occupational therapy devices like the one above which he knitted pot holders and other items. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Sister M. Clarita holding pot holder and standing beside occupational therapy patient Robert Brown with loom, in St. Francis Hospital
